body_html:
@orionr Thanks, compiling without GPU and without test in another fresh Anaconda environment ran through then. When trying to use Caffe2 for extracting features I get the Method VideoInput is not a registered operator. Did you mean: [] bug again however (which means that the operators inside caffe2/video/ did not get built, but this is a separate issue).

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "lib/extract_features.py", line 328, in <module>
    main()
  File "lib/extract_features.py", line 323, in main
    ExtractFeatures(args)
  File "lib/extract_features.py", line 126, in ExtractFeatures
    devices=gpus,
  File "/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caffe2/python/data_parallel_model.py", line 34, in Parallelize_GPU
    Parallelize(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caffe2/python/data_parallel_model.py", line 219, in Parallelize
    input_builder_fun(model_helper_obj)
  File "lib/extract_features.py", line 101, in input_fn
    use_local_file=args.use_local_file,
  File "/R2Plus1D/lib/utils/model_helper.py", line 120, in AddVideoInput
    data, label, video_id = model.net.VideoInput(
  File "/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caffe2/python/core.py", line 2171, in __getattr__
    ",".join(workspace.C.nearby_opnames(op_type)) + ']'
AttributeError: Method VideoInput is not a registered operator. Did you mean: []

body:
@orionr Thanks, compiling without GPU and without test in another fresh Anaconda environment ran through then. When trying to use Caffe2 for extracting features I get the [Method VideoInput is not a registered operator. Did you mean: []](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/12401) bug again however (which means that the operators inside `caffe2/video/` did not get built, but this is a separate issue).

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "lib/extract_features.py", line 328, in <module>
    main()
  File "lib/extract_features.py", line 323, in main
    ExtractFeatures(args)
  File "lib/extract_features.py", line 126, in ExtractFeatures
    devices=gpus,
  File "/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caffe2/python/data_parallel_model.py", line 34, in Parallelize_GPU
    Parallelize(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caffe2/python/data_parallel_model.py", line 219, in Parallelize
    input_builder_fun(model_helper_obj)
  File "lib/extract_features.py", line 101, in input_fn
    use_local_file=args.use_local_file,
  File "/R2Plus1D/lib/utils/model_helper.py", line 120, in AddVideoInput
    data, label, video_id = model.net.VideoInput(
  File "/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caffe2/python/core.py", line 2171, in __getattr__
    ",".join(workspace.C.nearby_opnames(op_type)) + ']'
AttributeError: Method VideoInput is not a registered operator. Did you mean: []
```
